name: cii_record_type
description: whether the individual in the record has other records that are digitized and whether those records can be linked using fingerprints
value_labels:
* 1 - automated
* 2- manual
* 3 - OBN (no CII record on file)
* 4 - Hybrid (began 1993)
notes: automated: fully digitized record; manual: paper records only; hybrid: mix of paper and digitized records; OBN: records that are not linked via fingerprints

name: cii_number
description: Statewide unique identification number for an individual.
question_text:
Enter the unique state identification number, referred to as the CII#, assigned to the subject's criminal
history record. If no CII number is available or known to the agency, leave the area blank and continue processing the form.

name: pdr_id
description: The Personal Descriptor Record ID indicates whether the offender is new to the system \textcolor{red}{[CORRECT?]}
value_labels:
* 00 - new offender (no arrest before 8/23/82)
* 01 - current offender (arrested before 8/23/82)
* 02 - unknown
* 09 - delete CII
notes: \textcolor{red}{proportion of current offenders highest when the data begin in 1982 but rapidly decreases to less than 10\% - that implies only 10\% of people arrested for a felony have a prior felony arrest???}

name: name
question_text: Enter the complete name of the subject as it was submitted on the arrest fingerprint submission or as indicated on the citation. Aliases, nicknames, or monikers are not required.

name: birth_year
question_text: Enter the month/day/year (MM/DD/YYYY) of the subject's birth.

name: birth_month
question_text: Enter the month/day/year (MM/DD/YYYY) of the subject's birth.

name: birth_day
question_text: Enter the month/day/year (MM/DD/YYYY) of the subject's birth.

name: gender
question_text: Enter the appropriate sex code abbreviation for the subject.
value_labels:
* M = Male
* F = Female
* X = Unknown

name: race
question_text: Enter the appropriate race code abbreviation for the subject. The criteria for determining race categories are in the TABLES Section.
value_labels: see race_or_ethnicity.csv
notes: The codes for Asian/Pacific Islander became more detailed in 1991. San Francisco did not change its reporting practices until 2012, when it adopted the FBI's categories for race: white, black, American Indian, other Asian, and other. Since 2012, San Francisco has not distinguished between non-Hispanic whites and Hispanic whites.

name: deceased
description: Whether individual is deceased, alive, or unknown.
value_labels:
* 0 - not deceased or no information
* 1 - deceased
* 2 - deceased (homicide)
notes: All NAs are for records with court event dates of 1982 (likely assigned for record-keeping) and predominantly for arrest dates in 1981 and 1982.

name: arrest_record_id
short_description: last reported step in crim justice process
description: where final disposition received or last reported step in criminal justice process.
value_labels:
* 10 - court disposition
* 11 - prosecutor
* 12 - police

name: arrest_event_year
question_text: Enter the month/day/year (MM-DD-YYYY) of: 1) the subject's arrest as it was submitted on the arrest fingerprint submission, 2) the date the complaint was sought or filed, or 3) the date of citation.

name: arrest_event_month
question_text: Enter the month/day/year (MM-DD-YYYY) of: 1) the subject's arrest as it was submitted on the arrest fingerprint submission, 2) the date the complaint was sought or filed, or 3) the date of citation.

name: arrest_event_day
question_text: Enter the month/day/year (MM-DD-YYYY) of: 1) the subject's arrest as it was submitted on the arrest fingerprint submission, 2) the date the complaint was sought or filed, or 3) the date of citation.

name: arresting_agency
question_text: Enter the complete name of the agency that arrested, cited, or requested a complaint be filed against the subject. Abbreviates for Type of Agency are acceptable; however, the county or city name should be spelled out followed by SO, PD, etc.
value_labels:
* PD Police Department
* SO Sheriff Office (Department)
* CHP California Highway Patrol
* MR Marshal
* INS United States Immigration and Naturalization Service
* FBI Federal Bureau of Investigation
* DA District Attorney
* CA City Attorney
* NTF Narcotic Task Force
notes: may actually be booking and not arresting agency

name: arrest_charge_type
value_labels:
* F - felony
* M - misdemeanor
* I - infraction
* X - unknown

name: multiple_arrest_charges
value_labels: 1-9 where 9 is 9+; prior to 1986 only used: 1 - one offense and 2 - more than one
notes: NA values appear to be true missings (distributed over various offenses and sentences) and only apply to arrests made in 1981 and 1982 or court cases in 1982

name: arrest_disposition_year
description: Date of final disposition decided by arresting officer.

name: arrest_disposition_month
description: Date of final disposition decided by arresting officer.

name: arrest_disposition_day
description: Date of final disposition decided by arresting officer.

name: arrest_disposition_type
display_name: release or decline to prosecute rationale
description: Release or decline to prosecute rationale.
value_labels: see dispositions.csv table
notes: prosecutor rejects is only the final disposition if the Court Record ID is blank

name: arrest_multiple_dispositions
prior_record_code
value_labels:
* 0 - no prior record
* 1 - misdemeanor conviction or "miscellaneous prior record"
* 7 - one prior prison commitment (felony conviction)
* 8 - two prior prison commitments (felony convictions)
* 9 - three or more prior prison commitments (felony convictions)
* blank - pre-1982 means lengthy record

name: arrest_offense
description: Offense for which individual was arrested.
value_labels: see cjis_codeTable.csv

name: arrest_qualifier
value_labels: see qualifier_codes.csv

name: arrest_summary_code
short_description: BCS summary code for arrest offense
description: BCS summary code for arrest offense.
value_labels: see bcs_offense_codes_variables.csv

name: court_record_id
value_labels:
* 20 - final disposition in superior court
* 21 - final disposition in lower court

name: court_event_year
notes: Seems to "root" the record as is the only year value that is the same as the year of the flat file from which the data are drawn.

name: court_event_month
notes: \textcolor{red}{[EG: does "court event" refer to beginning of trial or conclusion of trial?][VD: how is it that every record has this, even if not every record ends up in court?]}

name: court_judicial_district
value_labels: see judicial_districts.csv

name: court_disposition_type
value_labels:
* 21 - convicted
* 22 - acquitted
* 23 - not guilty, insane
* 24 - certified to juvenile court
* 25 - defendant deceased
* 26 - dismissed
* 27 - diversion dismissed (begins 1988)

name: court_multiple_dispositions
value_labels:
Pre 1986: 

* 1 - one disposition
* 2 - more than one

post 1985: 

* 1 - only one 
* 2 - 8 - two to eight
* 9 - 9+ dispositions
notes: all NAs are from court events taking place in 1982 and those records still have a sentence type (approximately 41K records)

name: sentence_type
notes: \textcolor{red}{although the OBTS tech manual says that this field is very unreliable but much of the missing data here comes from cases that were dismissed or diversion\_dismissed. Is this field unreliable for other reasons? Does filing as 17b4\_PC mean that a case is a retroactive effort to lower a felony conviction to a misdemeanor?}

name: sentence
value_labels:
* 01 - death
* 02 - prison
* 03 - CYA
* 04 - CRC
* 05 - MDSO
* 06 - probation and jail
* 07 - probation
* 08 - probation
* 09 - fine
* 10 - other: sentence suspended; work program; volunteer program; no sentence
* 11 - prison term suspended (post 1984)

name: court_charge_type
value_labels:
* F - felony
* M - misdemeanor
* I - infraction
* N - place holder codes
* X - unknown level of arrest
notes: among cases with a value of ""placeholder"" all had an arrest offense level of felony. Almost all of the placeholder offenses correspond to a conviction offense of 66085. Sentences varied.

name: court_multiple_disposition_charges
value_labels:
Pre 1986: 

* 1 - one offense
* 2 - more than one

post 1985: 

* 1 - only one 
* 2 - 8 - two to eight
* 9 - 9+ offenses
notes: \textcolor{red}{[EG: is this always the number of conviction charges, or are there charges associated with non-conviction dispositions?]}

name: court_disposition_offense
value_labels: see cjis_codeTable.csv
notes: \textcolor{red}{[are there other/older CJIS code tables that we can use? most often missing are 66085, 13998, and 66038}

name: court_qualifier
value_labels: see qualifier_codes.csv
notes: \textcolor{red}{[are there other/older qualifier code tables that we can use? Most often missing are AW, XX, KA, MJ, ML, MC, ME, MB, MD]}

name: court_summary_code
value_labels: see bcs_offense_codes_variables.csv
notes: \textcolor{red}{[why are the missings for conviction summary code and conviction CJIS code the same - was there never a CJIS code for some of the values in OBTS?]}
